title: My Big Time Travel Destinations
name: My Big Time Travel Destinations
description:
A Map by Kfische2

Place's I have visited in my lifetime!

properties.name: Alaska
properties.description: Posted by Kfische2AlaskaWhen I was 15 I got to go on a cruise to Alaska. Although it is not technically out of the country I am counting it because it was pretty far away and not everyone just goes to Alaska for the heck of it. Alaska was beautiful and full of wildlife. After the cruise we continued further into Alaska and stayed in a few cool lodges, hiked a lot, and did many other outdoor activities! One of my favorite things I have ever done in my life was in Alaska. We got to ride a helicopter up into the mountains and land on a glacier. There we got out and "explored" it was amazing and I have way to much to say about it so I will stop. :)

properties.name: Athens and Greek Isles, Greece
properties.description: Posted by Kfische2Athens, GreeceCan you say shocking?! I was suprised at how dirty and crowded a lot of Athens actually was. My junior year of high school my family went to Greece for our Spring Break. This has to be one of the highlites of my life! The Greek Isles are the most beautiful and fascinating places I know of in the world.

properties.name: Austria- Alps
properties.description: Posted by Kfische2Salzburg, AustriaWhile visiting Germany we took a day trip into Austria to go up into the Alps and play in the snow. We had fun and they were beautiful!

properties.name: Cancun, Mexico
properties.description: Posted by Kfische2Cancun, MexicoOhhh YEAH!! Now this was just for fun! Cancun is beautiful and very touristy but, I enjoyed every bit of it. I went to Cancun with one of my best friends and her family the summer before my senior year in high school.

properties.name: Home Base
properties.description: Posted by Kfische21660 Huntingdon TrailMy house in Atlanta. This will be homebase because this is where I live and travel from.

properties.name: London, England
properties.description: Posted by Kfische2London, EnglandWhen I was 15 my grandparents took one of my cousins and I on a wonderful trip to London and Paris. In London we had 5 days to tour the city and of course see as many sights and historical landmarks as possible. I really enjoyed The London Eye, Harrods, and Buckingham Palace.

properties.name: Munich, Germany
properties.description: Posted by Kfische2Munich, GermanyWhen I was in 3rd grade I had my first opportunity to travel outside the United States. I went to Germany with my Mom, Aunt, and cousin Caroline to visit a family member.(My pictures are all hard copies and I have not scanned and uploaded them into my computer yet)

properties.name: Nassau, Bahamas
properties.description: Posted by Kfische2Nassau, BahamasWhen I was 15 I went on a mission trip to the Bahamas. We put on a day camp for the orphans on the Island of Nassau. Everyone thinks of Atlantis when you talk of the Bahamas but the truth is there are many poverty stricken people on just the opposite side of the island. I learned a lot on this mission trip and also got to experience the luxury aspect of the Bahamas for a day or so as well.

properties.name: Paris, France
properties.description: Posted by Kfische2Paris, FranceThis has to be one of my favorite places that I have visited. From the Eiffle Tower, The Louvre, and beautiful parks and sights everywhere I had an absolute blast taking it all in. They say it\'s the city of love, well I fell in love with the city!

properties.name: Turkey
properties.description: Posted by Kfische2Ephesus, TurkeyOn our trip to Greece we cruised the Greek Isles, one of the cruise stops actually stopped in Turkey. This was VERY different than anything I had seen even in Greece. The people seemed pushy and rude, but my mom thankfully was BOUND AND DETERMINED to get to Ephesus. In the end I was glad I got to experience this as well. It helped me understand history so much better!
